result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Derrick Robert Peters

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Derrick Robert Peters in court.  Attorney Patrick Dennis Wait in court for Derrick Robert Peters.  Prosecuting attorney Tristan J. Bednarek in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Scheduling conference held. For reasons stated on the record, defense counsel requests an additional scheduling conference. Case is adjourned to Br. 29.
Scheduling conference scheduled for November 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report 10-17-22, filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5. Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription. Defendant to be monitored by drug testing. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Defendant advised No Contact/ No Firearms Order remains in full force and effect.  Defendant to have no contact with EK.

Defendant Derrick Robert Peters appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Patrick Dennis Wait appeared by video for Derrick Robert Peters.  Attorney Karine O'Byrne appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kiefer, Branch 29. This hearing may be streamed live at the discretion of the Court via https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/c105c3fe-89b8-5d05-5f8c-b6cf0d4921da
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Derrick Robert Peters not in court.  Attorney Patrick Dennis Wait appeared by video for Derrick Robert Peters.  Prosecuting attorney Tristan J. Bednarek appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Scheduling Conference. Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued REMAND TO COMMISSIONER. Court further takes no action as to bail.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.
Case set for a scheduling conference on 7/29/22 at 8:30 am. Court is down and unable to hear the matter. Case is rescheduled to 9/2/22 at 10:30 am. Parties notified via email.

Defendant Derrick Robert Peters in court with attorney Patrick Dennis Wait.  Student Intern Jessica Birmingham under the supervision of Lisa M Valenti-Jordan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Scheduling conference held. Defense counsel needs a global offer from the State and requests an additional scheduling conference.  Case is adjourned to Br. 29.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 29, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Pretrial Services Discharge Report 5-16-22, filed.

Defendant Derrick Robert Peters in court with attorney Patrick Dennis Wait.  Lisa M Valenti-Jordan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Bail/bond hearing held.  Matter held via Zoom video conference and streamed through DAcast. Defendant has new pending matters and Court does not address bail at this time. Court converts the plea and sentencing hearing to a scheduling conference.  Case is adjourned to Br. 29.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 29, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report 5-12-22, filed.
Pretrial Services Violation Report 5-10-22, filed.

Defendant Derrick Robert Peters in court with attorney Patrick Dennis Wait.  Lisa M Valenti-Jordan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case set for a jury trial.   Matter held via Zoom video conference and streamed through DAcast. Parties are prepared to proceed court passes case.

CASE RECALLED. SAME APPEARANCES. Defense requests a plea and sentencing hearing and a bail/bond hearing.  Case is adjourned to Br. 29.  This hearing will be streamed live via https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/c105c3fe-89b8-5d05-5f8c-b6cf0d4921da  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for May 12, 2022 at 02:30 pm.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 29, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report 4-27-22, filed.
Defendant's Motion in Limine, received and filed.

Defendant Derrick Robert Peters in court with attorney Patrick Dennis Wait.  Samuel Tufford appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Final pre-trial held. Matter held via Zoom video conference and streamed through DAcast. Case remains in trial posture. Case remains calendared for a jury trial on 4/27/22 at 8:30 am in Branch 29.  This hearing will be streamed live via https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/c105c3fe-89b8-5d05-5f8c-b6cf0d4921da
Pretrial Services Supervision Report 4-1-22, filed.
State's Witness List, received and filed.
State's Motion in Limine, received and filed.

Defendant Derrick Robert Peters in court with attorney Patrick Dennis Wait.  Katie Bakunowicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Bail/bond hearing held.  Matter held via Zoom video conference and streamed through DAcast. Defense counsel does not have an update for the Court. Court takes no action as to bail. Case remains calendared as previously set in Branch 29.  This hearing will be streamed live via https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/c105c3fe-89b8-5d05-5f8c-b6cf0d4921da
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Bail/bond hearing on March 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Final pre-trial on April 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial on April 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Court REINSTATES Justice Point supervision at the previous level ordered. All previously ordered conditions of bail to remain the same.

Defendant Derrick Robert Peters in court with attorney Patrick Dennis Wait.  Mario Fiumefreddo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Bail/bond hearing held.  Matter held via Zoom video conference and streamed through DAcast. Arguments heard as to the no contact order. Additional statement made by E.K. Court will not amend the no contact order at this time. Defense requests an adjourned bail/bond hearing  and Final Pretrial and Jury Trial dates. Any witness lists, special jury instructions, and motion in limine to be filed 48 hours before the final pretrial date. Court orders case adjourned for final pretrial and jury trial in Branch 29. This hearing will be streamed live via https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/c105c3fe-89b8-5d05-5f8c-b6cf0d4921da  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for March 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for April 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for April 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Pretrial Services Discharge Report 2-2-22, filed.

Defendant Derrick Robert Peters in court with attorney Patrick Dennis Wait.  Mario Fiumefreddo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Pre-trial conference held.  Matter held via Zoom video conference and streamed through DAcast. Defense counsel recently received discovery and requests a scheduling conference. The victim requests the no contact order be modified. State objects. Court adjourns matter for a bail/bond hearing for further information. Case is adjourned to Br. 29.  This hearing will be streamed live via https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/c105c3fe-89b8-5d05-5f8c-b6cf0d4921da  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for February 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report 1-25-22, filed.
received and filed.

Court reminded defendant of previous conditions of bail, including the no contact order.  
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Level 5 Supervision.

Defendant Derrick Robert Peters in court with attorney Charles Robert Roozen.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.  
Court ordered bench warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.  Case remains scheduled for Pretrial Conference on 1/25/2022 at 1:30 pm, Br. 29.
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 750.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Defendant Derrick Robert Peters not in court.  Karen Lynch Vespalec appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failed to appear for book and release on 1-07-2022 by 3:00pm. Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued. REMAND TO COMMISSIONER. Court orders that any bail on deposit is forfeited. Court stays order of forfeiture with recompense to be determined at close of case.

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 3:00 P.M. ON (1-08-2022). IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.
The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in a manner and fashion as prescribed.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Court ordered no contact with EK.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Derrick Robert Peters in court.  Patrick T. Franken appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Kiefer, Branch 29.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant.  Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant was given a referral to the Public Defender's Office. Defendant MAY be Public Defender eligible.  
The case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Br. 29.
Court ordered arrest warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
